items.title: Vogue’s Wintour taps successor to lead editorial at the iconic magazine
items.standfirst: Chloe Malle, who has been with the magazine for more than a decade, will take the top job even as Wintour stays on.
items.content: Chloe Malle, who has been with the magazine for more than a decade, will take the top job even as Wintour stays on.

items.title: Anna Wintour names her successor at Vogue — but she remains in charge
items.standfirst: Anna Wintour has named Chloe Malle as her successor as head of editorial content at American Vogue, ending weeks of speculation.
items.content: Anna Wintour has named Chloe Malle as her successor as head of editorial content at American Vogue, ending weeks of speculation.

items.title: Vogue promotes Chloe Malle to top editor spot
items.standfirst: Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer. (Image credit: Evan Agostini)
items.content: Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer. (Image credit: Evan Agostini)

items.title: Vogue promotes Chloe Malle to top editor spot
items.standfirst: Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer.
items.content: Vogue from legendary editor Anna Wintour.'/>Malle takes over as the leader of American Vogue immediately. Malle, who has been with the publication since 2011, will still report to Anna Wintour who remains Condé Nast's chief content officer.(Image credit: Evan Agostini)

items.title: Vogue Names Chloe Malle New US Editor, Succeeding Anna Wintour
items.standfirst: Condé Nast’s Vogue magazine named Chloe Malle as the head of US editorial content and the successor to Anna Wintour, who led the magazine for nearly four decades and elevated it further as a fashion powerhouse.
items.content: Condé Nast’s Vogue magazine named Chloe Malle as the head of US editorial content and the successor to Anna Wintour, who led the magazine for nearly four decades and elevated it further as a fashion powerhouse.

items.title: Vogue names Chloe Malle as new head of US edition
items.standfirst: Vogue staffer Malle succeeds Anna Wintour with the title ‘head of editorial content’ The biggest job in fashion has finally been filled.Following news that Anna Wintour was stepping back as editor of American Vogue in July, Condé Nast have appointed 39-year-old journalist and Vogue staffer Chloe Malle as head of editorial content at the American fashion magazine. Her role is effective immediately. Continue reading...
items.content: Vogue staffer Malle succeeds Anna Wintour with the title ‘head of editorial content’ The biggest job in fashion has finally been filled.Following news that Anna Wintour was stepping back as editor of American Vogue in July, Condé Nast have appointed 39-year-old journalist and Vogue staffer Chloe Malle as head of editorial content at the American fashion magazine. Her role is effective immediately. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Chloe Malle will become head of editorial content at American Vogue immediately.
Malle has worked at Vogue since 2011 and will report to Anna Wintour.
Anna Wintour will remain Condé Nast's chief content officer.
The appointment of Malle ends weeks of speculation about the role.
Wintour led Vogue for nearly four decades, elevating it as a fashion powerhouse.

clusters.title: Strong aftershock hits Afghanistan after quake kills more than 1,400
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghanistan Earthquake Death Toll Exceeds 1,400

items.title: Strong aftershock hits Afghanistan after quake kills more than 1,400
items.standfirst: Many remain trapped under rubble as rescuers use helicopters in remote areas hit by recent landslides.
items.content: Many remain trapped under rubble as rescuers use helicopters in remote areas hit by recent landslides.

items.title: Afghanistan death toll passes 1,400 as second earthquake strikes
items.standfirst: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...
items.content: Taliban appeal for aid, with casualties expected to increase as rescue teams struggle to reach isolated areas The Taliban have called for international aid as Afghanistan reels from an earthquake that killed more than 1,400 people and left thousands more injured.Rescuers searched into the night for survivors after the 6.0-magnitude quake struck on Sunday destroying entire villages across the country’s eastern Kunar province, which borders Pakistan. Continue reading...

items.title: Taliban appeal for international aid after deadly Afghan earthquake
items.standfirst: The Taliban have urgently called for international assistance following a deadly earthquake in eastern Afghanistan. The disaster has claimed over 1,400 lives and injured more than 3,000 people in Kunar province alone. The United Nations warns that casualties are likely to rise sharply as rescue efforts continue. Immediate humanitarian aid is needed to support medical care, shelter, and food for the survivors. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley has the analysis.
items.content: The Taliban have urgently called for international assistance following a deadly earthquake in eastern Afghanistan. The disaster has claimed over 1,400 lives and injured more than 3,000 people in Kunar province alone. The United Nations warns that casualties are likely to rise sharply as rescue efforts continue. Immediate humanitarian aid is needed to support medical care, shelter, and food for the survivors. FRANCE 24's Angela Diffley has the analysis.

items.title: Death toll soars past 1,400 as rescuers battle to reach earthquake survivors in Afghanistan
items.standfirst: The death toll passed 1,400 in the 6.0 magnitude earthquake that hit Afghanistan, the Taliban said, as rescuers raced to reach survivors trapped in remote areas.
items.content: The death toll passed 1,400 in the 6.0 magnitude earthquake that hit Afghanistan, the Taliban said, as rescuers raced to reach survivors trapped in remote areas.

items.title: Watch: Buildings destroyed and rescue efforts under way after deadly Afghanistan earthquake
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and thousands injured in the east of the country after a 6.0 magnitude earthquake struck on Sunday night.

items.title: ‘There is death in every home’, families say, after at least 800 killed in Afghanistan earthquake – as it happened
items.standfirst: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...
items.content: Several villages in Kunar province ‘completely destroyed’, says public health ministry, as rescue operations take place. This live blog is closedMagnitude 6 earthquake hits eastern AfghanistanHow have you been affected by the earthquake?One resident in Afghanistan’s Nurgal district, one of the worst-affected areas in Kunar, said almost the entire village had collapsed under the force of the earthquake. “Children are under the rubble. The elderly are under the rubble. Young people are under the rubble,” the villager, who did not give his name, told the Associated Press.“We need help here,” he pleaded. “We need people to come here and join us. Let us pull out the people who are buried. There is no one who can come and remove dead bodies from under the rubble.” Continue reading...

items.title: BBC reports from scene as Afghanistan earthquake rescue mission gets under way
items.standfirst: Rescuers are having to travel by helicopter to the worst-hit areas, as they have been cut off by the earthquake.
items.content: Rescuers are having to travel by helicopter to the worst-hit areas, as they have been cut off by the earthquake.

items.title: At least 800 dead after magnitude-6 earthquake hits eastern Afghanistan
items.standfirst: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescuers try to reach people trapped under mud and debris while hampered by destroyed roads and steep terrainA powerful earthquake that hit mountainous eastern Afghanistan has left at least 800 people confirmed dead and injured about 2,500, Taliban officials have said as rescuers struggled to reach the worst-hit villages.The magnitude-6 earthquake struck several provinces close to the Pakistan border around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged region of Kunar the most severely affected. There were landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

items.title: Afghanistan earthquake kills over 1,400 and destroys villages - all we know so far
items.standfirst: Over 1,400 people have been killed and at least 3,250 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to the Afghan Red Crescent Society.
items.content: Over 1,400 people have been killed and at least 3,250 others injured after an earthquake hit eastern Afghanistan, according to the Afghan Red Crescent Society.

items.title: At least 800 killed as powerful earthquake rocks Afghanistan
items.standfirst: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.
items.content: At least 800 people have been killed and over 1,000 have been injured in Afghanistan after a 6.0-magnitude earthquake hit the country, Taliban officials said Monday.

ai_summary: An earthquake in Afghanistan killed over 1,400 people.
Thousands more were injured in the 6.0 magnitude quake.
Rescuers are struggling to reach isolated areas.
The Taliban have appealed for international aid.
Some villages in Kunar province were completely destroyed.

clusters.title: Trump threatens to send troops to Chicago as judge rules that L.A. deployment violated federal law
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump's Use of National Guard in Los Angeles Ruled Illegal

items.title: Trump threatens to send troops to Chicago as judge rules that L.A. deployment violated federal law
items.standfirst: President Trump has threatened to send troops to Chicago as part of his crime and immigration crackdowns. Meanwhile, a California judge ruled that the Trump administration's deployment of the National Guard to Los Angeles, California, violated federal law. CBS News' Aaron Navarro has more from the White House.
items.content: President Trump has threatened to send troops to Chicago as part of his crime and immigration crackdowns. Meanwhile, a California judge ruled that the Trump administration's deployment of the National Guard to Los Angeles, California, violated federal law. CBS News' Aaron Navarro has more from the White House.

items.title: Trump's use of National Guard in Los Angeles was illegal, judge rules
items.standfirst: The ruling comes as Trump seeks to use National Guard troops in order to crack down on crime in other US cities.
items.content: The ruling comes as Trump seeks to use National Guard troops in order to crack down on crime in other US cities.

items.title: US judge declares Trump’s National Guard deployment to Los Angeles illegal
items.standfirst: US District Judge Charles Breyer questioned Trump's rationale that the Los Angeles protests constituted a 'rebellion'.
items.content: US District Judge Charles Breyer questioned Trump's rationale that the Los Angeles protests constituted a 'rebellion'.

items.title: A California judge rules that Trump's deployment of the guard to LA was illegal
items.standfirst: President Trump took control of the state's National Guard in June and deployed it to Los Angeles to face anti-immigration protestors and assist officers making detentions and deportations.
items.content: President Trump took control of the state's National Guard in June and deployed it to Los Angeles to face anti-immigration protestors and assist officers making detentions and deportations.(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)

items.title: LIVE: Judge rules Trump’s use of US National Guard in Los Angeles illegal

items.content: US Congress returns to session amid renewed unrest. Chicago braces for possible federal troop deployment.

ai_summary: A judge ruled Trump's deployment of the National Guard to LA illegal.
The judge questioned Trump's rationale for the deployment.
Trump threatened to send troops to Chicago.
The deployment was to face anti-immigration protestors.
The deployment was to assist officers making detentions and deportations.

clusters.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
clusters.neutral_headline: Bolsonaro Faces Trial Over Alleged Coup Plot

items.title: Brazil: Deliberations underway in unprecedented trial of former President Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.
items.content: Brazil’s Supreme Court began deliberations Tuesday in the historic trial of former President Jair Bolsonaro, an ally of Donald Trump, who is accused of plotting a coup to stay in power after losing the 2022 election. FRANCE 24's correspondent in Brazil Jan Onozsko describes the hearing as unprecedented, marking the first time a former Brazilian president has faced such a trial.

items.title: Trial of Brazil’s Bolsonaro enters verdict phase over alleged coup plot
items.standfirst: The former president is charged with five counts, including plotting the assassination of senior officials.
items.content: The former president is charged with five counts, including plotting the assassination of senior officials.

items.title: Why is Brazil’s Jair Bolsonaro on trial — and what’s next?
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after 2022 election loss.
items.content: Former Brazilian president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after 2022 election loss.

items.title: Jair Bolsonaro faces justice over alleged attempt to usurp Brazilian democracy
items.standfirst: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president in court along with seven others accused of failed power grab after losing 2022 electionBrazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro and seven of his allies, including four senior members of the military, have gone on trial for allegedly attempting to stage a coup – the first time in Brazilian history such powerful figures have faced justice for seeking to topple the country’s democracy.Bolsonaro, a paratrooper turned far-right populist who governed from 2019 until 2023, stands accused of masterminding a failed power grab after losing the 2022 election to the leftist Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

items.title: Trial of Brazil's ex-President Bolsonaro enters final phase
items.standfirst: The former president is accused of plotting a coup to remain in power after he lost the 2022 election.
items.content: The former president is accused of plotting a coup to remain in power after he lost the 2022 election.

ai_summary: Brazil's former President Bolsonaro is on trial.
He is accused of plotting a coup after losing the 2022 election.
Seven others are also accused in the failed power grab.
The trial is the first time such figures face justice in Brazil.
Bolsonaro governed from 2019 until 2023.

items.standfirst: Landslide destroyed a village in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivorMore than 1,000 people have been killed in a landslide in western Sudan, according to a rebel group that controls the area.The landslide on Sunday, which followed heavy rain, destroyed the village of Tarasin in the Marra mountains area of western Sudan and left only one survivor, the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army (SLM) said. Continue reading...

clusters.title: French film star Depardieu to face trial accused of rape of actress Charlotte Arnould
clusters.neutral_headline: French Actor Depardieu to Face Trial for Rape

items.title: French film star Depardieu to face trial accused of rape of actress Charlotte Arnould
items.standfirst: Film star Gerard Depardieu, one of the leading faces of French cinema, will face trial on charges of raping actress Charlotte Arnould in 2018, in the latest blow to his reputation after he was convicted of sexual assault earlier this year. Arnould first accused Depardieu of rape in 2018, saying the assaults occurred in his Paris home on two separate occasions when she was in her early 20s. Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.
items.content: Film star Gerard Depardieu, one of the leading faces of French cinema, will face trial on charges of raping actress Charlotte Arnould in 2018, in the latest blow to his reputation after he was convicted of sexual assault earlier this year. Arnould first accused Depardieu of rape in 2018, saying the assaults occurred in his Paris home on two separate occasions when she was in her early 20s. Depardieu, 76, has denied wrongdoing in the case.

items.title: Gérard Depardieu to face trial over rape and sexual assault allegations
items.standfirst: His accuser, Charlotte Arnould, says she is relieved the case is going to court, seven years after she filed a complaint.
items.content: His accuser, Charlotte Arnould, says she is relieved the case is going to court, seven years after she filed a complaint.

items.title: French actor Gerard Depardieu to face trial over alleged rape and sexual assault of fellow actor

items.content: French actor Gerard Depardieu has been summoned to face trial in Paris over allegations of rape and sexual assault against actress Charlotte Arnould.

ai_summary: Gerard Depardieu will face trial for rape.
The charges stem from an alleged 2018 incident.
The accuser is actress Charlotte Arnould.
Depardieu has denied any wrongdoing.
The trial is a result of Arnould's complaint.

clusters.title: GPS jamming of leader's plane puts Putin's hybrid warfare on Europe's radar
clusters.neutral_headline: GPS Jamming of Leader's Plane Raises Concerns

items.title: GPS jamming of leader's plane puts Putin's hybrid warfare on Europe's radar
items.standfirst: NATO said Tuesday it was working to prevent Russian GPS jamming after a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen lost satellite navigation over Bulgaria.
items.content: NATO said Tuesday it was working to prevent Russian GPS jamming after a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen lost satellite navigation over Bulgaria.

items.title: Italy considers hiding state flight paths after jamming of von der Leyen plane
items.standfirst: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...
items.content: EU member states debate how to make leaders’ flights more secure as Russia blamed for GPS lossItaly is considering keeping state flights secret after the satellite signal of the aircraft carrying the European Commission president, Ursula von der Leyen, was allegedly jammed by Russia, Italian defence ministry sources said.Von der Leyen, a fierce critic of the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, and Moscow’s war in Ukraine, was flying to Bulgaria on Sunday when her charter plane lost satellite navigation aids, delaying its arrival in Plovdiv, and reportedly forcing it to circle an airport for an hour. Continue reading...

items.title: British teen on Georgia drug charges could be freed for ‘many zeros’ sum
items.standfirst: Lawyers for Bella Culley negotiating plea agreement, court reportedly toldThe pregnant British teenager Bella Culley has reportedly been told she will be released from the Georgian prison where she is being held on drug-smuggling charges if she pays a substantial fine.Culley, from Billingham, on Teesside, has been detained in the former Soviet country for more than three months after being accused of trying to bring in 14kg of cannabis in a travel bag. She has been told she faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted. Continue reading...
items.content: Lawyers for Bella Culley negotiating plea agreement, court reportedly toldThe pregnant British teenager Bella Culley has reportedly been told she will be released from the Georgian prison where she is being held on drug-smuggling charges if she pays a substantial fine.Culley, from Billingham, on Teesside, has been detained in the former Soviet country for more than three months after being accused of trying to bring in 14kg of cannabis in a travel bag. She has been told she faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Top genocide scholars say Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world’s top scholars on the crime say

items.title: Top genocide scholars say Israel is committing genocide in Gaza
items.standfirst: The leading group of genocide scholars has agreed that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide.
items.content: The leading group of genocide scholars has agreed that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide.

items.title: Israel committing genocide in Gaza, world’s top scholars on the crime say
items.standfirst: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...
items.content: International Association of Genocide Scholars resolution backed by 86% of members who votedThe world’s leading genocide scholars’ association has backed a resolution stating that Israel’s actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of the crime.Out of the International Association of Genocide Scholars’s (IAGS) 500 members, 28% took part in the vote. Of those who voted, 86% supported the resolution. The resolution states that “Israel’s policies and actions in Gaza meet the legal definition of genocide in article II of the United Nations convention for the prevention and punishment of the crime of genocide (1948).” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Leading genocide scholars say Israel's actions in Gaza meet the legal definition.
The International Association of Genocide Scholars backed the resolution.
86% of voting members supported the resolution.
